author: NewsBreak Original
text:
By Peace A ,
9 hours ago Duane Chapman from Dog the Bounty Hunter ’s daughter, Bonnie Chapman, shed nearly 60 lbs in the past ten months, and she is crediting a weight loss drug for the feat. She shared an Instagram video in collaboration with telehealth service Morph Wellness, which helped her achieve her goal.
Bonnie is one of Duane’s 13 children from six relationships, and she has struggled to lose weight for most of her life due to PCOS or polycystic ovary syndrome. The condition has kept her at risk of developing type 2 diabetes; however, her new regimen has helped refine her diet.
What drug helped Bonnie Chapman with her weight loss? Bonnie Chapman/Instagram Bonnie used the weight loss drug Tirzepatide, which is often sold as Zepbound or Mounjaro brand. She claims it helped her rethink her eating choices, as she would feel sick after eating something sweet or unhealthy. She soon realized she could only feel fine by ingesting the right nutrients, and her lifestyle was reformed.
The drug also helps to keep her full for longer, and she eats less frequently than the previous years. Now that she has hit her goal weight, Bonnie is directing the focus to toning out her body and getting rid of residual fat. “Thank you for helping me make these dreams a reality,” her caption read.
Duane Chapman/ImageCollect Fans praised Bonnie Chapman for her new look Bonnie’s testimony and new appearance evoked reactions from fans, some of whom could relate to her PCOS and weight loss struggles. “I HATE PCOS, it’s EVIL. I’m sorry you have it too. You look so good!” someone wrote, and another added that they were on the medication as well.
Bonnie Chapman/Instagram Some compared Tirzepatide to the infamous Ozempic, which has been popular among celebrities like Sharon Osbourne and Adele. “You were gorgeous before the weight loss and after, but I am glad you are on a journey to improve your health!!!!” a second follower exclaimed.
